importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the publication date of the article, indicating when the current food supply situation in Gaza was assessed and reported.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline is centered on the most recent update about food supply levels and ceasefire conditions, highlighting the current humanitarian crisis and response.

keyTakeAways: Food supplies to Gaza are significantly below the WFP's daily target of 2,000 tonnes, with only 750 metric tonnes entering daily.
Only two Israeli-controlled crossings—Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara—are operational, restricting aid flow.
The UN World Food Programme (WFP) has 26 food distribution points open, up from five, but still far below the target of 145.
The ceasefire brokered by US President Donald Trump is seen as vital for saving lives and preventing famine in northern Gaza.
Hamas has pledged to hand over 28 captives’ bodies, and has so far delivered 13; the Rafah crossing remains closed until further notice.
Nutrition supplies for children and pregnant women have reached northern Gaza via southern routes, but not in sufficient quantities.
Many Palestinians are rationing food due to fear of supply disruptions, storing food for emergencies.
Current supplies are enough to feed about half a million people for two weeks.

namedEntities.name: UN World Food Programme (WFP)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An international humanitarian agency that provides food aid to people in crisis.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP reports on the current state of food supplies in Gaza, highlighting the shortfall from targets and calling for more open crossings.

namedEntities.name: Karem Abu Salem
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A border crossing into Gaza from Israel, located in the southern part of the territory.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is one of the only two operational crossings currently open, allowing a small amount of humanitarian aid into Gaza.

namedEntities.name: al-Karara (Kissufim in Israel)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A border crossing into Gaza from Israel, located in central Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is one of the two active crossings and serves as a key route for food deliveries into central Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Rafah border crossing
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A border crossing between Gaza and Egypt, currently closed.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Its closure limits humanitarian access to northern Gaza and restricts potential aid flows from Egypt.

namedEntities.name: Salah al-Din Street
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major north-south road in Gaza, currently blocked to WFP convoys.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP has not been granted permission to use this route, restricting access to northern Gaza and delaying aid to the north.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former US President, who brokered a ceasefire agreement during the Gaza conflict.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His 20-point plan for ending the war includes provisions for full humanitarian aid, making him central to the political context of aid delivery.

namedEntities.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Israeli Prime Minister, who has stated the Rafah crossing will remain closed until Hamas returns captives’ bodies.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His position on closing the Rafah crossing directly affects aid access and humanitarian logistics in Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian political and militant group, which holds responsibility for security in Gaza and has agreed to return captives’ bodies.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas has committed to returning 28 captives’ bodies and has so far delivered 13, which is a key condition for reopening crossings and easing aid access.

namedEntities.name: Qassam Brigades
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A militant wing of Hamas responsible for military operations in Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It confirmed the exhumation and handover of two Israeli captives’ bodies, indicating progress on the prisoner exchange agreement.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The UN World Food Programme reports that daily food supplies to Gaza remain critically low at around 750 tonnes—far below the target of 2,000 tonnes—due to only two Israeli-controlled border crossings being open. While aid has increased since the US-brokered ceasefire, access remains severely restricted, with humanitarian agencies like WFP unable to use key routes such as Salah al-Din Street or the Rafah crossing, which remains closed. The WFP emphasizes that opening all crossings is essential to sustain the ceasefire and prevent famine, particularly in northern Gaza. Hamas has confirmed the handover of 13 of 28 pledged captives’ bodies, a condition tied to the reopening of aid routes, while many Palestinians are rationing and storing food due to ongoing uncertainty about the ceasefire’s duration.
title: WFP says food supplies to Gaza below targets, urges more crossings to open
